TextView.android:text: Mutually Exclusive Events
In this lesson, we will learn how to find the probability of mutually exclusive events.
Introduction to lesson
Click on the video to start watching a lecture on the probability of mutually exclusive events
Video Source: https://youtu.be/UKuCyADXAlg?si=3xXizE_JR5ssnsaq5

1. a dice showing a 3 or a 5
2. drawing a jack or a queen
3. selecting a vowel or a consonant from the word PROBABILITY
4. spinning a 5 or an even number on a roulette with numbers from 1 to 10
5. rolling a pair of dice and getting a sum of 8 or a sum of 10
Let us visualize the mutually exclusive events using Venn Diagram. Observe that the circles representing each do not overlap.
The probability of A or B occurring is their respective probabilities added together.

There are six faces in a die: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6. There exists one 2 and one 5.

Thus,
The probability of die showing a 2 or 5 is 1/3.

(a) getting either all heads or getting exactly two tails?
(b) getting either all tails or getting at least one head?
(c) getting either exactly two heads or exactly two tails?
(d) getting neither all heads nor all tails?
(e) getting neither exactly one head nor exactly one tail?
Show Solution
Solution:\n\n(a) Let

P(A) = P(all heads) is the probability of getting all heads.
P(B) = P(exactly two tails) is the probability of getting exactly two tails.

There are 8 possible outcomes when tossing coins three times in succession: {HHH, HHT, HTH, THH, TTH, THT, HTT, TTT}.
There is 1 outcome of getting all heads (HHH) and there are 3 outcomes of getting exactly two tails (TTH, THT, HTT).

Thus,
The probability of getting either all heads or getting exactly two tails is 1/2.
(b) Let

P(A) = P(all tails) is the probability of getting all tails.
P(B) = P(at least one head) is the probability of getting at least one head.

There are 8 possible outcomes when tossing coins three times in succession: {HHH, HHT, HTH, THH, TTH, THT, HTT, TTT}.
There is 1 outcome of getting all tails {HHH} and there are 7 outcomes of getting at least one head {HHH, HHT, HTH, THH, TTH, THT, HTT}.
The word “at least one head” means one or more heads.

Thus,
The probability of getting either all tails or getting at least one head is 1.
(c) Let

P(A) = P(exactly two heads) is the probability of getting exactly two heads.
P(B) = P(exactly two tails) is the probability of getting exactly two tails.

There are 8 possible outcomes when tossing coins three times in succession: {HHH, HHT, HTH, THH, TTH, THT, HTT, TTT}.
There are 3 outcomes of getting exactly two heads (HHT, HTH, THH) and also 3 outcomes of getting exactly two tails (TTH, THT, HTT).

Thus,
The probability of getting exactly two heads or getting exactly two tails is 3/4.
(d) Let

P(A) = P(all heads) is the probability of getting all heads.
P(B) = P(all tails) is the probability of getting all tails.

There are 8 possible outcomes when tossing coins three times in succession: {HHH, HHT, HTH, THH, TTH, THT, HTT, TTT}.
There is 1 outcome of getting all heads (HHH) and also 1 outcome of getting all tails (TTT).

Thus,

In any experiment, the sum of probabilities of all events is always 1. Thus, to get the probability of getting neither all heads nor all tails subtract the probability of getting all heads or getting all tails from 1.
The probability of getting neither all heads nor getting all tails is 3/4.
(e) Let

P(A) = P(exactly one head) is the probability of getting exactly one head.
P(B) = P(exactly one tail) is the probability of getting exactly one tail.

There are 8 possible outcomes when tossing coins three times in succession: {HHH, HHT, HTH, THH, TTH, THT, HTT, TTT}.
There are 3 outcomes of getting exactly one head (TTH, THT, HTT) and also there are 3 outcomes of getting exactly one tail (HHT, HTH, THH).

Thus,

In any experiment, the sum of probabilities of all events is always 1. Thus, to get the probability of getting neither exactly one head nor exactly one tail, subtract the probability of getting exactly one head or exactly one tail from 1.
The probability of getting neither exactly one head nor exactly one tail is 1/4.
